SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Show Product Specs on the Product Detail Page

Help buyers determine whether a specific product satisfies their purchasing criteria. When you create physical, operational, or performance specifications for a product, you can easily include those specifications on the Product Detail page.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To create CC Page Section records:	Create on CC Page Sections
To edit custom object fields:	Customize Application
To modify CC Spec records:	Edit on CC Specs

The Product Detail page organizes spec information in the following ways:

Page Section (1)
Shows one or all specs for the product. In the Capricorn Coffee demo storefront, specs display in a page section configured as a tab in the main content column in the page layout. Optionally, you can create a page section for specs that displays as a widget in the right column of a multi-column page layout.
Spec Group (2)
A heading in the page section that groups one or more specs together. You can show one spec group (one heading) or multiple spec groups (multiple headings) within the page section.
Spec (3)
The name of a spec. You can determine which specs you want to include.
Spec Value (4)
The product's assigned value for a particular spec.

To show specs on the Product Detail page:

Specify the possible Spec Group headings that you can assign specs to.
NOTE The default Spec Group picklist values—such as Processor and Networking—generally apply to computer hardware products. Update these values so that they better suit your storefront's products.
Find the fields and relationships for the CC Spec custom object.
In Lightning Experience, click the Object Manager tab in Setup. Select CC Spec, and then scroll to the Fields & Relationships section.
In Salesforce Classic, enter Object in the Quick Find box in Setup, and then select Objects. Select CC Spec and scroll to Custom Fields & Relationships.
Click SpecGroup.
Scroll to the Values section, edit the available picklist values, and save your changes.
Create a page section configured to show spec information.
On the CC Page Sections tab in your org, click New.
For Display Type, select Tab or Widget.
If you selected Tab for Display Type, enter the name of your storefront's tab group in Grouping.
NOTE The Product Detail page supports only one group of page section tabs. In the Capricorn Coffee demo storefront, the default tab group name is tabSec.
For Page Name, select ProductDetails.
For Section Name, select how many spec groups to show.
Specs-Single
Show only a single spec group in the page section.
Specs-All
Show all applicable spec groups in the page section.
If you selected Specs-Single, use the Section Filter Other field to enter the name of the one spec group you want to show, such as General.
For Location, select Main Content or Right Column, depending on which Display Type you selected.
Enter a Sequence value, specify a Storefront, and save your changes.
NOTE To determine the order of tabs or widgets, B2B Commerce for Visualforce compares the Sequence values of all page sections with the same Display Type and Location. Lower Sequence values display first.
Configure which specs you want to show on the Product Detail page.
On the CC Specs tab in your org, find the record for a spec that you want to include, and click Edit.
For Display Name, enter the name for the spec that you want to show on the Product Detail page for applicable products, such as Grade.
Enable Is Visible in Catalog.
For Spec Group, select the group whose heading you want to include the spec under, such as General.
If necessary, adjust the Sequence value.
NOTE To determine the order of specs shown on the page, B2B Commerce for Visualforce compares the Sequence values of all specs with Is Visible in Catalog enabled. Lower Sequence values display first. This order applies to both the list of specs on the Product Detail page and the order of facets on the Product List page.
Save your changes.
Repeat this step for other specs that you want to include.
Refresh the product spec index.
SEE ALSO

title: Customizing Product Specifications on B2B Commerce
